questionTitle: Which of the following service provider provides the highest level of service?
questionExplanation: As you move upward in the stack, each service model inherits the capabilities of the model beneath it, as well as all the inherent security concerns and risk factors.

questionOption2: IaaS adds application development frameworks, transactions, and control structures
questionOption3: SaaS is an operating environment with applications, management, and the user interface
questionExplanation: IaaS has the least levels of integrated functionality and the lowest levels of integrated security, and SaaS has the most.

questionTitle: Which of the following functional cloud computing hardware/software stack is the Cloud Reference Model?
questionExplanation: Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) is a not-for-profit organization with a mission to â€œpromote the use of best practices for providing security assurance within Cloud.

questionTitle: For the _________ model, the security boundary may be defined for the vendor to include the software framework and middleware layer.
questionExplanation: In the PaaS model, the customer would be responsible for the security of the application and UI at the top of the stack.

questionOption1: Each different type of cloud service delivery model creates a security boundary
questionOption2: Any security mechanism below the security boundary must be built into the system
questionOption3: Any security mechanism above the security boundary must be maintained by the customer
questionExplanation: As you move up the stack, it becomes more important to make sure that the type and level of security is part of your Service Level Agreement.

questionTitle: Which of the following model allows vendor to provide security as part of the Service Level Agreement?
questionExplanation: Compliance, governance, and liability levels are stipulated under the contract for the entire stack.

questionTitle: Which of the following cloud does not require mapping?
questionExplanation: Private cloud may be internal or external to an organization.

questionTitle: Which of the following service model is owned in terms of infrastructure by both vendor and customer?
questionExplanation: Infrastructure location is both on- and off-premises.

questionTitle: Which of the following model type is not trusted in terms of security?
questionExplanation: It is owned by a vendor.

questionTitle: Which of the following has infrastructure security managed and owned by the vendor?
questionExplanation: Cloud computing has a tendency to blur the location of the defined security perimeter in such a way that the previous notions of network firewalls and edge defenses often no longer apply.
